lines.text: That's all right, Stanley. Just remember, you're helping me clean stables Sunday.
I'll remember, if the wind is right.
"In the year 1900, there lived a chorus boy named Stanley Snodgrass, who worked his way up from the gutter... only to discover that he had a round trip ticket."
What're we supposed to be, support for a chorus boy?

[helping him up]
Are you hurt, Stanley?
Only my pride...

[rubbing his bottom]
... but it goes pretty deep.
How can my public discover me if Fraser keeps kickin' me out of his shows? In the chorus, you've danced behind a lot of big stars, Daisy, and from the back, don't I have as much as any of them?
More, Stanley.
Failing is the only thing I've ever been a success at.
[Stanley got literally thrown out of his broadway show]

[noting Stanley still in costume]
You should have changed into your own clothes.
In mid-air?

[to Stanley]
I am NOT your daddy. I'm your mother's husband, and I refuse to be responsible for any mistakes but my own.

[to his mother, after thinking it over]
I think he insulted one of us.

[having removed his belt]
One side, Emily, while I butter the toast of Broadway.
Will I see you tomorrow, Stanley.
Oh, don't come to the bottom of the river just for that.
Man, what a performance. I haven't seen anything like it since Fink's mules.
Logan, I told you to take the rest of the night off.
A gentleman's gentleman NEVER takes the night off, sir.
Yes, but does a gentleman's gentleman stay when the gentleman wants the gentleman's gentleman to leave the gentleman with the lady?
A gentleman is never alone with a lady, sir.

[sighs]
You're now working for a cad. By the way, the money's the same. Go.
Anything I can't stand it's peeking through a keyhole and gettin' the busy signal.
Anything on fire?
And how. Oh, that, yeah. That's a gentleman's perfume. That's my own blend, my dear. It's called Blue Snodgrass. You have to have a license to use it. Does it do somethin' to you?
Yes! But if we open a window, I think I will be all right.
Oh, please, Stanley. One toast with our producer.
All right - one. But remember, I can count.
And what happened to my blindfolded violinist.
Uh, they're leading him upstairs now.
Oh, please, turn off those mice!
Ah, I wish I was a girl so I could fight over me.
My ministers do not control me, oh Princess of magnificent beauty. Only I make the decisions that are... continued on next girl.
You can't trap the rat if you remove the cheese. Get Snodgrass back on that stage, and hurry up!
He's alive! Who's responsible for this?
